title: Splinkerette Assay

authors.name: Aazam Vahdatshoar
authors.affiliation: Khurana Lab, Harvard Medical School, Brigham and Women's Hosptial

source.description: Passage and harvest the cells following the cell culture protocol.

source.body: 100,000 cells would give enough genomic DNA.

source.description:

source.body: The pellet is very loose now.

source.description:

for later genomic DNA extraction.

Measure the DNA concentration using a nanodrop.
Set all reactions from here to the end with a positive control alongside the gDNA prepared above.

source.body:
You may use the piggybac plasmid construct that was transfected into the cells for positive control.


Genomic DNA 2 µg
Sau3AI enzyme (5-20 units) 1 µL
10X cutsmart buffer 3 µL
DNase/RNase-free H2O to final volume 30 µL

Set the digestion reaction as listed in a tube.

Adaptor mix (25 µM) (prepared above) 1 µL

Set up the primary PCR amplification in a PCR tube.


Taq 2X Master Mix 10 µL
Spkt-Primer Mix-1 1.5 µL
Template (from step 6.5.3 elute) 5 µL
DNase/RNase-free H2O 3.5 µL
Final volume 20 µL

Taq 2X Master Mix 10 µL
Spkt-Primer Mix-1 1.5 µL
Template (from step 6.5.3 elute) 5 µL
DNase/RNase-free H2O 3.5 µL
Final volume 20 µL

Run the reaction in the thermal cycler with the following program for Taq 2X master mix polymerase.


Initial denaturation 95°C 3 min 1X
Denaturation 95°C 30 sec34X
Annealing 55°C 30 sec
Extension (1min/kb) 68°C 2 min
Final extension 68°C 5 min 1X
Hold 4°C Forever

Initial denaturation 95°C 3 min 1X
Denaturation 95°C 30 sec34X
Annealing 55°C 30 sec
Extension (1min/kb) 68°C 2 min
Final extension 68°C 5 min 1X
Hold 4°C Forever

.

Taq 2X Master Mix 10 µL
Spkt-Primer Mix-2 1.5 µL
Template (from step 6.6.3) 1 µL
DNase/RNase-free H2O 7.5 µL
Final volume 20 µL

Run the reaction in the thermal cycler with the following program for Taq 2X master mix polymerase.

source.body:
Annealing temperature and final extension time are different from the 1st PCR.


Initial denaturation 95°C 3 min 1X
Denaturation 95°C 30 sec34X
Annealing 57°C 30 sec
Extension (1min/kb) 68°C 2 min
Final extension 68°C 20 min 1X
Hold 4°C Forever

source.description:
Store PCR product at
.
Run the PCR product from step 28 on 1.5% agarose gel.

source.body: The number of bands would indicate the number of integration sites if more than one copy is integrated. It may also indicate the polyclonal nature of the cell line with different integration locus in each clone. The positive control plasmid should show only one band.

source.description:
Gel purify each band separately. Store at
.

source.body: However, fresh product would be more efficient for Topo TA cloning.

source.description:

Gel-purified PCR product (from step 6.8.2) 0.8 µL (0.4-1.6 µL)
Salt solution 0.4 µL
Topo vector 0.4 µL
DNase/RNase-free H2O 0.8 µL
Final volume 2.4 µL

source.body: Topo TA cloning kit uses vector pCR4 for cloning. Primers M13 reverse and M21 forward have binding sites on either side of the cloning site on the vector. We only need to sequence with one of these primers. Though the primers are provided in the TOPO TA cloning kit you may submit the samples without them because sequencing facilities have these primers, too. Follow the guidelines on submitting samples for sequencing provided on vendor’s website.

source.description: Fill the submission form on vendor’s website. Choose their relevant in-house primer from their primer list and mention on the form.

source.body: The sequencing result would show the genomic sequence right before the 5‘ ITR end of the piggybac construct as well as part of the construct.

source.description: Blast the genomic sequence on NCBI website for the exact locus the piggybac construct has integrated.

description: This protocol used to find the exact location of the integrated piggybac construct in the genome of stably transfected cell line. This assay determines the copy number of an exogenous gene in the established monoclonal piggybac cell line as wells as their insertion loci.
